entries.text: Under the Riksbank's publications, you will find the latest analyses of monetary policy, financial stability, the payment market and other subjects.

entries.title: Statistics | Sveriges Riksbank - Riksbanken
entries.text: The Riksbank publishes information on exchange rates and market rates. We also compile some statistics on payments and turnover on the financial markets.

entries.title: Search interest rates and exchange rates | Sveriges Riksbank
entries.text: You can search for published exchange rates and interest rates in the database at the following time intervals: day, week, month, quarter and year.

entries.title: The Riksbank's monetary policy
entries.text: The objective of monetary policy is to maintain a low and stable rate of inflation. More precisely target is to hold CPIF inflation at around 2 per cent a year.

entries.title: What is monetary policy? | Sveriges Riksbank - Riksbanken
entries.text: The objective of monetary policy is to maintain low and stable inflation. The main monetary policy tool is the policy rate.

entries.title: Evaluation of monetary policy | Sveriges Riksbank - Riksbanken
entries.text: Transparency and clarity at the Riksbank are important for both democratic oversight and effective monetary policy.

entries.title: Monetary policy decisions | Sveriges Riksbank - Riksbanken
entries.text: The Riksbank normally holds eight monetary policy meetings per year, at which the Executive Board takes decisions on monetary policy. Click on the latest ...

entries.title: Speeches and presentations | Sveriges Riksbank - Riksbanken
entries.text: Speeches are given by each Executive Board member one or more times a year. A speech is pre-written and published on the Riksbank's website in full.

entries.title: Press & published | Sveriges Riksbank - Riksbanken
entries.text: Under the heading "Press & published" you can find all of the Riksbank's publications, including reports, press releases and speeches.

entries.title: Policy rate is cut to 2 per cent | Sveriges Riksbank - Riksbanken
entries.text: The Executive Board has therefore decided to cut the policy rate by 0.25 percentage points to 2 per cent.

entries.title: High political uncertainty abroad increases stability risks - Riksbanken
entries.text: The risk of financial instability has increased. In this situation, it is of great importance to safeguard resilience, both in Sweden and globally.
